Review:
My rating is based on food, service, and space. I did not order any drinks.

I ordered the bulgogi sandwich, the BELT sandwich, and a berry overnight oats for my partner and 3 year old to share. The sandwiches were delicious and flavorful! Bread was perfectly toasted, yet still fluffy. Good ratio of all ingredients. My 3 year old also loved the oats and the egg in the sandwiches. I may need to come back next time and see if I can just order an egg sandwich for the kids.

They have a self service kiosk so ordering was very easy. Menu has pictures and lists out all ingredients. The woman behind the counter was also incredibly sweet; she saw my 3 year old and asked me if he would like a chocolate wafer stick/straw on the house.

Space was open and clean. Went on a Saturday morning and they still had plenty of seating available.

We inhaled the food before I remembered to take pictures.
Loved the tiramisu latte and the avocado sandwich
Used to be good and pipping hot, today the bread was cold, the veggies and the egg all cold, no salt and pepper bland sandwich. Disappointed. Waste of money.
Super cute little spot in downtown Bellevue. The servers were super nice and the bingsoo was really good, too! But the sandwiches left a little to be wanted. Needs more flavor, more punch!

Stopped in after a workout nearby based off an ad I saw on social media recently, and unfortunately fell into the “looks pretty, taste meh” category.

Nothing was wrong, everything was fine. I don’t want to spend 14$ for a “fine” sandwich and 12$ for a “fine” drink. I paid more for an extra shot of espresso, and it still tasted like milk. The BELT sandwich was okay, but for 14$ I do expect it to taste like more than just brioche bread. I tasted no bacon or tomatoes, the eggs were unseasoned, overall just ingredients hiding in fancy bread.

Staff were friendly and helpful, but it was all self service. If the prices drastically dropped I’d go back, but until then I’ll go literally anywhere else.

The coffee here is one of the better ones in the neighborhood. The sandwiches are pretty yummy, but every time I go, no matter what time of the day, the touch screens you order food from and the one you used to pay are filthy, like really gross. It’s always really discouraging.
Such a relaxing spot—cozy, warm, and inviting. The coffee is excellent, but what I love most is how comfortable it feels to sit here and unwind.

tucked into an apartment building by bellevue mall, semicolon cafe is a very minimalist and aesthetic cafe to go into. there was both a self order kiosk and register manned by an employee. i ordered the pistachio bomb latte, tiramisu latte, and the bulgogi sandwich. the prices were quite reasonable for the size of everything but was quite confused by the pistachio bomb latte as there was no espresso - turns out that the pistachio bomb has espresso and not what i ordered. the staff were very nice in explaining the difference and added the shots of espresso with no charge as well as a little sign stating their differences for the self order kiosk. the drinks were a bit on the sweeter side but still good and the sandwich was delectable! would definitely come again especially when you don't have to worry about parking :)
The Mango-Banana smoothie was delicious really.
Green smoothie was delicious

We felt really comfortable in the place. The design is stylish and bright, which made for a nice atmosphere.

About the drinks - the matcha latte was tasty, but the milk flavor was quite strong. Since the portion was 16 oz, it kind of felt like buying a glass of green milk. There was an option on the menu to pay +$0.50 for less ice, but we still got the usual amount of ice.

We also added mascarpone cheese on top as a paid extra, but the drink came without it. When we mentioned it, the staff quickly fixed the issue, which was appreciated. Still, having two little mix-ups with just one customer (two drinks) and not even during a busy time feels a bit off.

On a positive note, my brother ordered a drink with the LOX sandwich - the sandwich looked great and really appetizing, and he enjoyed it a lot.

I was really drawn to this place by the Google reviews, but in practice, I’m not sure I’ll be coming back again.

Unfortunately, I didn’t take a photo😢
I love their sandwiches and sauce.

Fluffy sandwich with good flavor. Just a headsup; if you’re in a hurry, you might want to skip it as the wait time can be a bit long. Also, the space is quite small compared to the crowd it draws so it can feel a little cramped during peak hours.

The bulgogi sandwich was quite disappointing. It didn't have much flavour, and was more like a western sandwich. The bread isn't like the typical fluffy bread you find in these Korean sandwiches, the lettuce felt out of place, and the sauce wasn't enough to save it. The portion size is avergae for these types of sandwiches, so not quite enough for a full lunch. Wouldn't come back for the sandwiches, but maybe the drinks are good!
Spent $8 on a small smoothie that hadnt even touched a blender. It was literally just a pile of whole frozen fruit with some juice poured over it.

I recently discovered this cozy little cafe that has some really unique sandwiches on the menu, and let me tell you, they taste amazing! The atmosphere is super relaxed, and I can totally see myself stopping by for quick lunches in the future. It's such a delightful spot!
Belt sandwich is so delicious! Good music and chill vibes.

isited Semicolon Cafe recently and the place definitely has a nice vibe — cozy ambiance and aesthetically pleasing setup. We tried the chicken sandwich, egg sandwich, and a coffee. The presentation was great; everything looked really appetizing. However, the taste didn’t quite match the visual appeal. The sandwiches were decent but could’ve used a bit more flavor. Coffee was okay, not the best but not bad either. Overall, a decent spot to hang out, but there’s room for improvement on the taste side. Rating: 3.8/5.
The matcha latte was delicious. The tuna sandwich was as delicious as the one I have in Japan.
Beautiful korean cafe that serves delicious sandwiches. I love my matcha and spicy chicken sandwich!
Went since friends recommended it, and I'm loving it. Service was great and kind, and made it easy for me to order. Quality stuff all around
The belt sandwich was tasty, and my tiramisu drink was perfect. Service was good.

Love it here but they keep forgetting to add corn on the bulgogi sandwich for the past month. And please please call out mobile order #s when they’re done so people aren’t waiting in the lobby when their meal is already done. Love you guys

Edit: owner responded that corn is in the egg, yes it should be but half the time it’s been missing entirely.

Came here for the first time and all I can say is WOW! I ordered the avocado sandwich and loved it.

The bread was light and fluffy and all of the ingredients inside worked together just right. Wish there was a little more sauce though (but still good). The sandwich was a little on the pricey side and kind of small for a full (it’s just right for a snack or light breakfast) meal but the quality and taste makes up for it.

The ambience is clean and calming, though there are limited seats as the cafe is quite small. However, I don’t think it’s an issue because it doesn’t seem too crowded.

Ordering is done through a kiosk and the food comes generally quickly. As for parking, I don’t think there’s much next to the cafe. I would recommend parking at the Bellevue square mall garage and then taking a short walk to the cafe, as it’s quite close.

Anyways, I will definitely be back to try more!

This place has AMAZING bingsoo. I was genuinely a bit terrified to eat it because of how many toppings they crammed in. I really cannot overemphasize how much cookie bits they crammed into the chocolate bingsoo. Well worth stopping by!!
At 4:30 denied service. Server said it’s past 4:30.
We had the ham sandwich and the bulgogi sandwich. Little light on the amount of meat in the sandwich.

We finally visited Semicolon Cafe—it had been getting quite a bit of hype, so I was curious to see what it was all about.

The space itself looks cute from far, and the concept seems promising, but the experience didn’t quite live up to the buzz. We arrived just a few minutes after opening on a weekend, and the staff already seemed a bit overwhelmed and confused, juggling multiple orders. Even though you order in a Tablet with no cashier interaction, it still took a while to get our coffee.
The ambience is very white, but the places is already showing the lack of cleaniless. Tables and chair chipped, looking dirty because it's all white.

Speaking of the coffee—it was just okay. Nothing memorable. Also, all the photos I had seen showed beautiful drinks in transparent cups, but ours came in basic paper cups, which was a bit of a letdown.

The sandwiches, unfortunately, were the biggest disappointment. They were kind of a mess—flavorless, overly drenched in mayo, and lacking everything.

Overall, it felt like one of those places that got popular on social media but doesn’t have much to offer beyond the aesthetic. Not terrible, just not worth the hype.
Delicious!
Foods is good.

Food is good. Get the tiramisu latte, it's amazing.

Minus one star because the girl working was too busy scrolling Instagram (standing behind the counter, I could literally see her scrolling Instagram) to take my order and I ended up using the self serve kiosk.

I recently visited this café and ordered a pistachio matcha with espresso. Honestly, the drink was average — nothing that really stood out.

What really frustrated me, though, were the extra charges. They charge 50 cents extra if you want light ice in your drink and another 50 cents if you choose fat-free milk. From a cost perspective, this makes no sense at all. It feels like they’re nickel-and-diming customers over basic customizations.

Also, if you’re doing self-checkout at their machine, be aware that they prompt you for a tip — even though you’re literally doing the checkout yourself. This is something that’s started happening at a few places lately, but it’s still frustrating and feels very off.

Overall, just be aware of all these extra charges before you go. Definitely not a place I would rush back to.
Wanted to go here for a long time and tried it !! Ordered Avocado sandwich and belt sandwich loved both .

Ordered 3 sandwiches: avocado delicious sauce, chicken yummy and spicy, Shroom tasty and light but somewhat bland.
All around very tasty and would definitely go again.
Sandwich size is perfect although looks big but it really isn’t.
Very light on the stomach since it’s all fresh ingredients and packed with veggies.
Amazing sandwiches and we love the honey walnut smoothie
Good place for Korean style sandwich which is operated by Chinese, sandwich is very tasty but matcha strawberry ice is nothing like the picture shown in the menu

The sandwiches and drinks here are really good—I’ve never had authentic Gilgeori Toast, so I can’t speak to authenticity, but I loved the flavor. The cafe has seating, so you can sit and enjoy your food, but it’s not a cozy spot to linger for long. Parking can be tricky—you’ll need to park at the mall and walk about five minutes, as street parking is limited. Overall, it’s a hit, and I’d definitely come back!

About $10-13 for a small sandwich (that didn't fill me) but super delicious and fresh. My husband got a Bulgogi Sandwich and I got Shroom, both were real tasty. We also ordered an iced Tiramisu Latte which tasted like a latte with ice cream and some syrup (it was great!). I would go back, just need to get more food afterwards. Good for cafe hopping.

Went with a friend, lots of seats, very aesthetic, food came out quickly and was tasty. Friend said the bingsu ($8) was as good as the more expensive ones from another place. Overall very nice experience, you order on the tablet so it's anxiety friendly! ☺️

This kind guy was amazing at 8:00 a.m.  matcha was beautifully served and delicious!! Sandwich very good !!..brought everything to my table…napkin.lid for drink !! It’s the kind little things that mean so much. Thank u.
The sandwich was full of mayo and the bread was too doughy for my taste. It’s good for one time experience but I wouldn’t return again.
I loved everything from my order!! Matcha was perfect (nice quality grade & they didn't skimp on the scoops), the Lox sandwich was so delicious, and the bread is so yummy!
I got food poisoning after eating their sandwich
We got food poisoning. The bulgogi was undercooked.

It looks prettier than it taste to eat. It's not bad, the sauces are good. But it's not a true representation gilgeori/Korean toast like you would get in Korea. It lacks the heavily buttered and fried bread and American cheese that makes the Korean native dish.

On its own it's a good egg sandwich but what it's trying to be it's not wholly accurate to the thing in Korea.

Semicolon Cafe in Bellevue is a delightful find, tucked away near the Safeway in Bellevue downtown. It’s a small spot, so it can be easy to miss while driving by. We usually park at Safeway and walk over, so I can’t comment on the availability of dedicated parking nearby.

The cafe is cozy but has limited seating, so it might be better suited for takeout during busy times. They offer a variety of options, including coffee, shaved ice, and their standout item: sandwiches. The menu leans heavily toward Asian-style sandwiches, though there are other choices as well.

My favorites are the Avocado and BELT sandwiches. The flavors are excellent, fresh, and thoughtfully crafted. However, the portions are a bit small for the price, so if you’re a big eater, consider ordering two to try different options. The coffee is decent—nothing extraordinary for me as I’m not a coffee enthusiast—but it pairs well with their food.

They also serve shaved ice, though I haven’t had a chance to try it yet.

Overall, Semicolon Cafe offers great food in a convenient location. While the prices reflect its downtown Bellevue setting, the quality and experience make it worth it. I highly recommend stopping by if you’re in the area and looking for a quick breakfast or brunch. They open at 8 AM, making it a perfect spot to grab something delicious before heading to work or during a break.
Good coffee.
The tiramisu latte is out of this world!!! I don’t even have a highly refined taste for caffeine, but this thing is addicting
Great all around cafe but the barista (Kousthubha?) made the winning difference!
succhh a cute place, food is great and the atmosphere is perf for studying!!

This spot serves really delicious Korean-style breakfast sandwiches! I tried the avocado sandwich with added ham and truffle sauce. The eggs were perfectly fluffy, the bread was soft with a crispy exterior, and the sauce, combined with the avocado and ham, pulled everything together beautifully. This sandwich truly hit the spot! I can’t wait to try a different combination next time.
10/10 a must stop.

My girlfriend and I recently visited this cafe and tried the Lox sandwich, the bulgogi sandwich and the pistachio latte – honestly, it was the best taste we’ve ever had! Incredible combination of ingredients, and the sauce was just fantastic. We’ll definitely be coming back. By the way, due to my own oversight, I paid for parking first and only then noticed they offer a free parking coupon. Now we know! 🥸

Great place for sandwiches as they are very delicious. It's a bit small for the price but they are very nicely presented.

Will certainly be back.
Honestly. If I’ve paid 10+for a bk sandwich Id expect fresh Avocado at least.

Tiramisu latte was bomb
Quick easy to order computer

I’ll be for real here: the drink options are pretty good I would say but they’re not exactly the “best”. I would go here again definitely but I feel like there are other places you could go in Bellevue to coffee/matcha and a sandwich. I’m not saying this place is bad at all, it’s great! But again, I’m just laying out my honesty.

“Okay” food rating was concerning. Latte had too much milk and burnt my mouth badly. Staff wasn’t friendly and it was clear they were ready to go home, not make another coffee. Cafe had a nice interior.

The is a niche small cafe with some very tasty sandwiches, coffee, and phenomenal parfaits.

The sandwiches are very delicious, and they have various offerings that are all very good.

The parfaits are unique in that they have pieces of cheesecake, as well as crunchy corn flake bits.  Not too sweet, and enough textures to really make this desert a treat.

I definitely recommend coming here if you are in the area.  You absolutely have to try the parfaits - as they are not to be missed!

I was having trouble deciding between the BELT and the Shroom sandwiches but luckily you're able to add items so I had the BELT with added mushrooms, so delicious! Ube cheesecake does not have a crust so to me it tastes like it's missing something but it's gluten free friendly for those that need that.
Pet friendly inside, service was great.

The Peach latte contains no espresso by default, even though it's in the coffee section of the menu. Having said that, it IS delicious, and the tiramisu latte was also very tasty. The staff was very nice and helpful, and the cafe is clean and welcoming, with a good amount of seating

The sandwiches are interesting and taste great. I loved that they had vegetarian options, too. I'm not a vegetarian, but as a tourist, I like to have a couple of healthy meals to offset the unhealthy/heavy ones.

Ordered the tiramisu latte based on other reviews, and it did not disappoint. They can make it with decaf espresso. Very cute presentation too.
Coffee is okay, atmosphere is good, but the service needs to be improved. First time there, no idea we need to order from the screen, there is no instructions.
Really enjoyed the pistachio latte 😊 dog friendly and family friendly! Great for grab and go.
Nice sandwiches in convenient Togo packaging. Liked their shroom and lox the best.
Nice place to have quick breakfast- variety of sandwiches, coffee
Delicious iced matcha and avocado sandwich what more can you ask for? A cute spot to meet for a friend date or grab a snack.
Great service, tasty food, wonderful place to go for a yummy lunch

Tasted straight up like oatmilk, and I could just tell from when she handed me the drink it was done wrong. I came here once prior to this, and it was a different person who made my matcha drink and it tasted amazing, and was definitely a different color (a more vibrant green) than what is in the picture, which is why I decided to return. Such a disappointment to start off the day with this.

Tried Mango and Matcha bingsoo - they are okay not too sweet but I expect the mango to be more ripe. You can park at the garage (entrance next to the store) but will need to use the promo code (which you get from the store) when you pay your parking through LAZ parking app - the promo code is for 2 hours free parking.

The environment is okay, but the Tiramisu coffee is sweeter than I expected, and the coffee taste is very weak, lacking the rich flavor of coffee. What made it worse was the terrible attitude of the staff. When I went to pick up my coffee, the staff member was on her phone the whole time and didn’t respond when I talked to her. This really ruined my morning. I hope the management improves, especially regarding the Asian female employee with braided hair.
The food was great, but the restaurant was not maintained clean
Hilarious!! Who calls a sandwich shop …colon cafe? lol! Food better be good! And it is! Totally Asian sandwiches and they are super Yum!!

Bulgolgi sandwich was a bit sweet but pretty tasty and VERY FILLING. Sandwiches were stuffed and they don’t skimp on the egg and meat!

3 stars though because the matcha latte had no flavor and just tasted like grassy water. Super thin and watery milk.
DO NOT ORDER THE MATCHA LATTE
Chic.

I got the bulgogi sandwich and the tiramisu latte. I seriously LOVE the sandwich, it has many different ingredients inside so if you are a texture person like me you would love it! The tiramisu latte is good but nothing too special, it’s refreshing though for a nice lunch. Gotta say though it is pretty expensive.

So happy we have a new breakfast/lunch spot in the neighborhood! The place looks cleaner than most of the starbucks here and the sandwiches are delicious! Love the drinks and the spicy chicken recipe but agree it can be spicier. I think the new employees need more training because I ordered more onions and my drink was overflowing a little bit but it's understandable. I can see myself going here every morning in the future so mad love to the owner of this place!!!

First time visiting, and it was a disappointing experience. We waited 30 minutes for an Americano and a latte after completing the payment, on top of the 10 minutes we spent in line. To make matters worse, three orders placed after ours were served first. After reminding the barista, we finally got our drinks within 3 minutes :(  40mins waiting for just two drinks. It’s ridiculous. Won't come back again.

I came here at least twice per month. It is a nice place to self study and stay to start a perfect Sunday morning. I knew Semicolon when I was in New York years back and surprisingly saw the store one year ago. Highly recommend the chicken, egg sandwiches. Korean Latte is my fav. It doesn’t taste as sweet as American Latte. Highly recommended!

Extremely arrogant staff! I hate to say this, but it feels like their service is biased, based on one's appearance.

Food / drinks are meh for the price. There are better cafés closeby within walking distance.

I was originally really excited to discover a new place in the neighborhood for breakfast and coffee. The sandwich looked ok but I found the coffee was sweetened. I politely told the lady (Asian lady in braids) that I was pre-diabetic and couldn't have this drink and expected to get offered to have the drink remade (as is usual at most places). Instead the lady with a sneer told me that it says the drinks have 2 pumps of syrup right on the menu. Looking around the store, I didn't see that mentioned anywhere so I asked to see the menu. She pulled out from under the counter, not a menu, but what was obviously a worksheet for employee use. After I pointed out that customers would not have access to this information when making their ordering decisions, she (with a really bad attitude) told me to dump my original drink and had a new one made. I don't know what level of service this lady is used to, but her attitude would not be acceptable anywhere and that especially doesn't fly in old Bellevue, Washington. I would give zero stars if I could.

This café is in the heart of Bellevue. The cafe oozes the morden and hip Korean cafe setting. Self-checkout and self-service. The sandwiches are delicious and loaded with fresh ingredients. The brioche bread is just as it should be. But the seating arrangement is the biggest turnoff for me. I am not sure whether it is a takeaway or a dine-in eatery. I understand the concept of a contemporary café, but if I'm paying around $50 for a meal for two, I would prefer a comfortable seating arrangement where individuals with long legs can fit. Very uncomfortable dining area. Aside from the set- up, the sandwiches are indulgent.

I have been to both the Jersey City and Bellevue semi colon cafe multiple times now, and can say the Bellevue outlet is a let down in front of the Jersey City one.
The sandwiches are great, but the signature Tiramisu Latte is being destroyed here. They just put the ingredients in a cup and serve it to you. I am aghast with the way the servers here serve and treat the customers.
The choco stick and the flakes which should be on the top for the exquisite looks and flavour sometimes are just at the bottom of the drink all messed up.
I hope the owner gets on top of this particular outlet and gets the things in line as I really expected the Jersey City experience here in Bellevue.

My partner and I visited for a late breakfast on a Saturday morning. I’d like to preface this by saying I usually don’t enjoy egg in general but the sandwiches looked so good I still wanted to try it and I’m so glad I did because the way they cook the egg is so light and fluffy it doesn’t have that rubber egg taste some dishes have. My partner had the Mango-ade which was refreshing and I had the Tiramisu Latte and it was so good I had to have another drink so I tried their limited Pistacho Bomb and it was really good too! Towards the end our meal an employee walked around giving samples of a drink to everyone sitting which was nice. Be prepared to take the food to go though because seating can fill up quickly, we asked for to go at first but luckily a table opened up while we waiting. Also they have their own promo code for parking on a board so don’t pay for the retail parking until you get inside!

Very cute sandwich shop with a hip but modern atmosphere. The placement of the shop is perfect because it’s on the corner of a popular street in Bellevue and you can come here and grab a snack then head to the park across the street. The food was decent, but the sandwich started to fall apart easily. Personally there was too much sauce on mine and made the bread soggy. Smoothies were good and refreshing. The pricing was pushing it, and definitely think they should be lowered based on the quality of the sandwiches. I just don’t think you should be charging up to $30 for bread, meat, and mystery sauce lol. The employees seemed nice, but with self check out being popular you don’t really interact with people behind a register nowadays, a bit sad and less personal. Will i go back? Maybe.
The sandwich was pretty good but the seating is mediocre. Most of the tables were dirty.

Hipster Asian fusion sandwich place that I had been on list to try and finally got to go.  This is definitely a place to try but would not be a go-to place if I was in the area.

Parking: Shared retail parking for the building
Pet friendly: Yes – I would have assumed no since the café is super tiny without an outdoor seating but there was a dog the day I went.
Family friendly: Yes if your child can sit on a backless stool without you worry they will fall off LOL

FOOD:
Overall: Go in knowing that there is a base for the sandwiches meaning all of them have scrambled eggs with grilled corn and lettuce in between toasted brioche bread.  This is my personal preference but I’m not a fan of brioche… its fluffy but its “too fluffy” that there isn’t a good density that holds everything in the sandwich.  No matter what I’ve had between brioche, it always always always falls apart.  The eggs did not have any taste to it… like it needed just basic salt and pepper.  I also didn’t taste any corn.  If I didn’t read corn in the menu description, I wouldn’t have thought there was any.

1. S.O.S Sandwich (base, tomato, red cabbage, cheddar cheese, Kiwi sauce, mayonnaise) $9.49: 2 Stars - I know some people are adverse to mayo but I love it.  But literally all I taste is mayo.
2. Chicken Sandwich (base, spicy chicken, red onion, jalapeno, mozzarella cheese, spicy sauce) $11.49: 2 Stars - Not spicy at all and the flavor was just okay.  I love spicy and there was barely a kick.
3. Lox Sandwich (base, Arugula, smoked salmon, red onion, yogurt dill sauce) $12.49: 3 Stars - I understand the sandwich is small but I feel like they skimped on the filling.  The ratio was off – meager amount of smoked salmon (like one slice/piece) to sauce.  All I could taste was mushy-non-corn-tasting-eggs and dill sauce.
4. Bulgogi Sandwich (base, tomato, marinated beef bulgogi, red onions, Bulgogi sauce) $11.99: 2 Stars - Bulgogi has a distinct flavor that I did not get here.  The one good thing I can say about this sandwich is there was at least a textural difference with it being a beef sandwich.

MENU/RESTAURANT:
When I walked in I actually thought this place was a walk up and order place only because of how uber small it was.  My plan was a quick sit down lunch with my family but we had to do take out as there was no way my 2 year old son could stably sit down on the modern cubes they had for most of their seating.   The loved the décor inside - very clean, simple, modern, and black and white.

I like the idea of the menu - small, streamline, and focused on a few things.  What is better than a pretty sandwich? I love carbs so anything in sandwich form is great.

SERVICE:
Meh.  You order from a tablet so you don’t actually have much interaction with anyone.  I saw a few folks behind the counter but no one that made eye contact or spoke to me until they called out my number… the girl just said the number, pushed out my bag, and didn’t really say anything else.

This was, singlehandedly, the BEST breakfast sandwich I have ever had. Yes, even better than most sit-down restaurants!

Semicolon feels like a place that has their customer top-of-mind. It’s a welcoming, well-decorated space that has clear pictures and pricing for their food and drinks, and even offers both wifi and parking recommendations with their own promo code! The space is set up very well for handling queues and giving folks space to sit and chat. Their drink and food options looked both tasty and pretty, and I appreciated the variety of flavor options they offer!
I did not try their drinks, but I was happy to see they offered different degrees of sweetness and caffeine for their lattes and espresso drinks. Whether you love a strong espresso flavor or “dessert in a cup” sweetness, this place has you covered! There’s also a small fridge that includes some canned drink options, along with some other sweet dessert/food options.

I ordered via a single machine at the front, which gives you a clear picture of the menu options and provides a HUGE level of customization! (Side note: if you get anxious about talking to folks when ordering, this place is a great option for you!) I ended up doing an add-on of bacon to my avocado sandwich, and saw a ton of different options for other ways to customize. I noticed a number of orders packaged up and waiting, so it looks like you also have the option to order ahead or order through a meal delivery app for this place!
Wait time was very minimal—it took about 5 minutes between me placing my order and hearing my number called out.

The sandwich here felt like everything I’d ever want and more! The brioche bread is crispy on the outside but fluffy and buttery and toasted in the center, and the korean-inspired sauce they used was a perfect blend of spicy and savory! I felt like I got a satisfying amount of each ingredient for the price point, and I loved the fact that this sandwich wasn’t super messy! It’s incredibly rare to find a well-stuffed breakfast sandwich that doesn’t fall apart or make a mess, but they found a way to do it!
Major props to the simple and cute presentation of my to-go order, it felt cute and charming, while also being super helpful for on-the-go travel!

I absolutely loved it! I’m excited to return (especially with friends) and can easily see myself spending a morning here, or grabbing a sandwich for lunch to take to the park (which is literally just one block down the street)!
Fantastic and understanding manager. Very nice atmosphere.  Really nice staff. Food was amazing. Definitely will come back to visit again soon!

I was here april 18th at 9am, the worker here is quite disrespectful. I came to get some coffee and a sandwich! When we arrived, the girl who worked there did not even greet us. Didn't say hello or anything! I would get it if it were busy, but it wasn't since it's literally a Thursday morning. I had a question regarding one of the beverages there and wanted to ask her, but she gave me an attitude and behaved as if I was oblivious or something! When she handed me my food, she didn't say anything, just left it there, and when I came up, she just slid the food to me again without saying anything. I saw she was constantly on her phone! Honestly, the service here is terrible! Listen to the other reviews; don't come here expecting nice service because it was really horrible! The sandwich was good, but I would not return here for the service!

Love this place, good pricing and quality food. For someone who skips breakfast and lunch us my first meal this is perfect. Staff are very nice too. I would only wish the space was a little bigger. For parking there is a garage rught after the store rught turn and they have a code inside the store for free parking.
Unprofessional Manager. Not friendly.
Most delicious sandwich i have ever had! Just perfect!
Free Parking with Promo Code

My most favorite quick brunch spot. Just divine! Super calm place to just order a quick bite, I like getting the shroom sandwich but they’re all great. Also love the tiramisu latte and my sister likes the matcha latte.

Really fun to finally get to try a Korean "Egg Drop"-style sandwich!!
Absolutely loved it!
Great place to grab a drink and bite. Enjoyed the natural light and large windows. Purrrfect spot to hang out!

Came here for tiramisu latte looking at other reviews. It doesn’t seem to have any espresso shot in it and is very sweet. Hot chocolate was really bad too. It was pink in color.  Nothing seemed authentic. I wouldn’t recommend.
i’ve been here a few times and love the chill atmosphere. the service is always super friendly and the drinks are awesome!
Erm why the freakity freak is it so expensive. $12 for a sandwich thats low-key middy widdy.

I've been here several times, coffee drinks barely have any coffee in it. Mocha is pretty much chocolate milk. It's odd. Such a cute ambience but the drinks just don't cut out. I've gotten their iced matcha drinks and it's very watery tasting.

I've ordered and had to wait to call someone out of the kitchen after 5 minutes. No other person waiting or orders being made. Not sure what the deal is, just very unusual. I've come in multiple times just to see if I can be proven wrong but it's seems to be consistently inconsistent here. They don't really pay attention to quality in drinks here or customer service

I don't recommend.

Tables too short for the seating, incredibly uncomfortable. No plugs for laptops, and while they clearly tried to make it look 'trendy' the execution is truly terrible. Cups are so cheap, the lids just collapse if you try to open the sip hole on them. They make you order through a screen, and the screen uses purposely deceptive language to try to get your phone number and get permission to send you promotional texts. Honestly so mad I came here.
I ordered the S.O.S sandwich. The egg has a nice soft texture and the kiwi sauce is interesting. There is parking conveniently located nearby.

nice environment but the bingsoo was mid.
the cup was inconvenient to eat out of and the bingsoo used to be better. lacked flavor.
I was there with my friends. Service is very bad . Staff doesn’t even wants to talk with us . They did not even say hi

first time visiting & the sandwiches were incredible. we ordered the truffle mushroom sandwich & yum! i love how soft the bread is, eggs are cooked well, veggies are fresh, truffle aioli was great, 10/10 recommend.

I have wanted to try this establishment for a while. However they may have incorrect information concerning their hours. We arrived at 4:30pm on a Saturday hoping to get a quick bite but were told that 'The kitchen is closed' and were refused service. If the main part of the business (cafe) stops operating at 4:30pm then that would be expected to be the closing time and not 5pm as stated on their window and online. With that you never know when they will decide that they are not making food, which shouldn't even take long since they are sandwiches and/or shaved ice. Professional businesses do not do this.
Delicious food,but a  bit too expensive.

super fun place - just what you’d expect. I got a sandwich (avocado) and the an iced tiramisu latte with coconut milk. The bread for the sandwich was good and the latte was super creative.

Service was just a touch pad but the food came quick.

Would try a different place before coming back but i would recommend it to anyone in the area! :)

I am from Seattle and I drove all the way to Bellevue for this breakfast sandwich the BELT. I have to say it is absolutely one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had. If you want a very clean and fresh perfect breakfast sandwich, I highly recommend this place! Everything is so fresh that’s in the sandwich. The bread is amazing. The eggs are perfectly fluffy and the mustard mayo is beyond… I also decided to get the Matcha espresso iced drink instead of milk I got almond milk… Again the best drink I’ve had in a very, very long time. Hands-down Coming back for sure and bringing friends
Like the idea and aesthetics of it but the dressing/sauce over the toast makes it soggy :/ their tiramisu coffee is delicious though.
Pretty epic sandwiches

I visited in the morning to buy a Green Machine smoothie and a cold brew coffee. Very happy with both and they opened the store on time.
A music in the background would be nice to have while waiting.
Had avocado sandwich and latte. Liked them both. Cute place with fast service

Avoid. Overpriced. Extremely arrogant staff.

ordered a Latte(2/10 - my office drip coffee is better) , Avocado Sandwich, Shroom Sandwich. Sandwiches are finger appetizers and not value for money (12$)

The bulgogi sandwich was good but the service was terrible! The employee’s attitude made me feel like they didn’t want me to be there (slide the order to me with her arm without greeting or even looking at me). Will not come back!
I do not recommend the coffee here. It's pretty bland.

I don’t normally write reviews but this place was so bad in service I had to share my experience.

First of all all of the workers there seemed so sad like they didn’t even want to be there. I would understand if they worked long hours and I judge on that. These workers don’t repeat your order back at all, I repeated twice that i wanted a Chai latte and even my boyfriend next to me heard but they just gave me a regular latte instead. When i confronted them about the mistake they just accused me saying that i said latte, not a chai latte. I was really upset and i’m not a confrontational person so it really hurt me and i just left it be. My boyfriend right after agreed with me that the workers there seemed like they hate us, it’s not a welcoming environment.

Food was ok, I would of given them another chance if i lived locally but if you live in a different city save your gas it’s not worth the drive…
Love the place! Such a cute small place, had the bingsoo, I wish I had the option to remove shaved ice as it was almost impossible to eat it in the cold. Sandwiches were good! Would def recommend

Sandwiches tasted fine
Menu had almost no detail of what was in each sandwich
Customer seating area was quite dirty
Bathrooms weren’t that clean and had toilet paper instead of paper towels 🤨
Wouldn’t go back
I would like to go again. Sandwiches tasted good. At least the presentation looks good too. Drinks not bad. In a way cozy once you get seats.
Had pick up order of avocado sandwich and espresso coffee. The sandwich is beautifully packaged, the meat is tender and juicy, and it tastes awesome..
Had the bulgogi sandwich and a drip coffee for takeout. The sandwich was good, but a little pricy. The brewed coffee however tasted like brown colored water with a spritz of coffee essence.

Took a bite of my sandwich and lettuce tasted like sand. Lettuce looked like it wasn’t washed. I started to pull out the lettuce and found two a dead flies. I couldn’t say anything to them because I drove from issaquah to pick up. Very disappointed.
Love the sandwiches and the coffee here! A pretty unique experience and selection of dishes compared to what we usually find in "cafes"
Very delicious!

Sandwiches were great, coffee was meh and looked nothing like their pics.

Could be cleaner in the customer area.
If you have any allergies don’t visit this place. This place doesn’t even have details or list of ingredients. Person who was serving knew nothing. We don’t order anything and just left.
Lox sandwich is heavenly 🥲

This is our second time visiting this city. The first time we came, this shop had just opened, but unfortunately, I didn't have time to check it out. This time, we came specifically to try the sandwiches recommended by many foodies.  The interior design of this store was simple and natural, especially with many plants ,creating a comfortable atmosphere. However, when I was about to take a photo, a female employee behind the counter said, 'Can I help you?' I turned to look at her, and she had a frowning, unhappy expression. I really don't know what was wrong with her.

To place an order, there was a large electronic screen to select the  items. We ordered the Lox smoked salmon and Shroom  portabella mushroom sandwiches for takeout. The food was served quite quickly, and we went to a nearby park for a picnic. The mushroom and egg had a nice texture, but the sauce and bread  all had a slightly sweet taste, which I didn't particularly like. Overall, it's not worth coming here specifically to try.
In town for the Browns’ game and this place was walking distance from the hotel. Great breakfast sandwich and a coffee got me pumped for the game.

This place is cute and inviting with a bunch of plants everywhere. I ordered the mushroom sandwich, and my sister ordered the crispy chicken. Both were flavorful. My sandwich had a truffle sauce that was creamy and savory, but I wish the actual mushrooms and scrambled eggs were hot. The bread was toasted and warm but nothing else was which was kinda disappointing but atleast the flavors were good and the sandwich was filling.
Yummy sandwiches!
Egg sandwich was shockingly good

I've been in a few times. The chicken or avocado sandwich is always a good thing, always nice and warm. The matcha bingsoo is pretty tasty, too. The specialty lattes can be just a bit too sweet for my taste. The tables can be a bit dirty from time to time. Street parking can be a bit of an issue, but there is a garage, too.

Known for its brioche sandwiches, specialty lattes, and bingsoos, this café integrates yummy food with a modern, trendy venue.

Ordering is made easy with a touch-screen menu. Great place for a quick bite & modern, trendy vibes 🪴We had the lox & avocado sandwiches 🥪
Drink is excellent.  Will try the sandwich next time.

Purchased the Oatmilk Chai Latte. Drink was very sweet. Definitely the worst Chai Latte I’ve ever had in my life. I would give this place zero stars if I could.

Update:

General Manager called back, and made it right. Greatly appreciate them for reaching out.
Amazing place, great coffee (Tiramisu Latte) and delicious sandwich

I recently came here with my grand daughter for breakfast. It was my first time and Im glad to chose this place. the breakfast sandwiches here are next level. The sandwiches are almost a hybrid of a breakfast sandwich and a regular sandwich.  But they hit the mark with the best of both worlds. I had the bulgogi breakfast sandwich. It was simply amazing! It had a really tasty sauce, and the brioche was the perfect choice for their sandwiches. Very, very good. Can't wait to come back!

Mignon (cute) sandwich!

The combination of kiwi sauce + egg with melted cheese tucked inside + thinly sliced cabbage brought a wave of nostalgia of Isaac Toast sold in Korea.
I really love this place.  Bulgogi sandwich is amazing!!!
Fantabulicious coffee drinks! We had a delicious tiramisu latte and a divine cappuccino. Highly recommend!!!
Not a huge fan of the food
My friend and I ordered the bugolgi sandwiches which were pretty tasty. I also ordered the pink lady matcha that was pretty good.

Food is okay. But the self service kiosk automatically charges 18% of tip!!! While this is fully self-service. Watch out for that.

Edit:
The business replied saying that the custom “can” choose their tip % in the payment page. This is true, but there is a huge difference between a user ‘can’ navigate to some pages to choose % tip but that’s not really obvious if you use it the first time and if you fail to do that it charges 18% tip, like this case, or make the tip choice in an obvious way during payment.

Again the fact that they have the audacity to ask for tip and telling me I ‘can’ opt out of tip while this is 100% self service is disgusting.

This is not really representative of a Korean sandwich shop (it feels sort of like they tried to copy it but something is missing). The bulgogi sandwich is the most decent.

I  ordered the SOS sandwich one time and they left out a lot of ingredients: the scrambled eggs with corn that was supposed to be in the sandwich, skimpy on the tomato, and they forgot to add the ham that I had paid for as extra. I called to let them know and they said they’d refund me for the sandwich but I’d probably won’t order other sandwiches from here again.

The place is also not the cleanest. You have to buss after previous customers because they don’t really wipe the tables after each customer leaves.

I came to this place looking for a place to sit down and do some work while eating some breakfast. I walked in and the place was empty and the girl working didn't acknowledge me at all. Instead of taking my order, there was a huge tablet in front of the counter that you placed your order on. You're prompted to leave a tip even though you've had zero interaction with the people working, not even a hello.
I was the only customer in there. The music was incredibly loud. I went to the bathroom while waiting for my food. While I was in the bathroom, the girl started yelling "order for one!" over and over and over. Like settle down girl. I'm washing my hands and there's literally no one else in here. So anyway, I go to the counter and ask for a to-go cup with water and it was clear she didn't want to give it to me but she did it begrudgingly. I ended up leaving with my food and drinks because the whole vibe was off and the girl was super rude. The bread on my sandwich was super soggy and the whole experience wasn't worth the $20 I paid for it.
Won't recommend, food is not the best.
Thr sandwiches are quite nice and light.  The bread is incredibly soft.  The egg is very nice and not overcooked.  The sauce is quite lovely.  Lastly I really enjoyed the mango lemonade.

The coffee was ok. Orders are taken at a kiosk and then left on the counter to be picked up when ready. Practically no human interaction. In fact when our order was ready I barely got a "thank you" in so much that is was under her breath and with no eye contact. I regret tipping, as the effort and gratitude was not there. Will not go back.
Yummy coffee and sandwiches! Good atmosphere. I’m about it.

The brioche bread is fantastic. Sauce in the sandwich was also great. Eggs nicely done too. Only thing would be the chicken came across a bit dry and bland itself, but the sauce on it was flavorful, just needed more! Cute interior and decent service speed.
An innovative and tasty selection of sandwiches and a modern decor.

The only good thing is pretty looking sandwiches and at friendly staff. Low quality coffee. Very dirty interior tables and bathroom.The bulgogi on my sandwich was cold, the bottom half of it was as ugly as the top half was pretty. The interior and bathroom were very off-putting and concerning. So dirty.

Semicolon is cute little cafe in downtown Bellevue serving Korean egg sandwiches, drinks, and pastries. The interior is small with limited seating but is nicely decorated with lush greenery. When we arrived around noon, the restaurant was quite busy with no seating available. We ordered via the kiosk and had the option to customize our order (ex. change sauces). After about 15 mins, we got our food - an avocado sandwich for myself and a mushroom sandwich for my friend. I enjoyed my food - the avocado was creamy, the egg was cooked well and I especially liked the brioche bread and its buttery and light taste. The only drawback is the cost - $10 for a simple sandwich seems a little pricey to me.

Very cute cafe in downtown Bellevue! Conveniently located near my place so I come here frequently. I love the tiramisu latte and bulgogi sandwich (the other sandwiches are delicious too!). Service is very friendly, helpful, and efficient. Just want to note though, many times the tables here are not wiped down in between customers, as there are usually crumbs on the tables when I come in.

Sandwiches were medicore. The little "service" interaction was poor...yet these places default their automated tip at 18% 🫤.

Don't waste your money here.
The Avocado sandwich was amazing! It wasn’t crowded when I first got there but it got busy pretty quickly. The cold brew was a bit on the bitter side but it was still good!

We stopped at Semicolon Cafe in Bellevue for a quick and tasty lunch on a short 2 night getaway that we made to the Seattle/Bellevue area.They serve some really tasty Korean Egg Drop sandwiches as well as a variety of refreshing drinks, macarons, pudding, and bingsoo. Korean Egg Drop sandwiches consist of thick slices of Brioche bread stuffed with fluffy scrambled eggs and a variety of other fillings. (I couldn't actually find the words Egg Drop Sandwich anywhere on their menu or their website, but they serve Bingsoo which is a Korean dessert and their sandwiches match all the pictures and descriptions of Egg Drop Sandwiches that pop up if I search for "Egg Drop Sandwiches" on Google. So, I'm very sure that's what they're serving!)

There's a rectangular screen set up where you can place your order electronically. We ordered:

Brewed Coffee
Caramel Latte
Lady Matcha
Chicken Sandwich
Avocado Sandwich

Our first time eating Korean Egg Drop sandwiches and this was a marvelous introduction to it. Usually our picky eater isn't a fan of egg. Faced with these sandwiches she was a bit apprehensive at first. After eating these sandwiches though, she loved them so much that she asked if we could eat there again on the way home!

Their drinks were wonderful as well, and it's got a very aesthetic feel to it. Highly recommend this place!

Service: Good
Parking: 2 hour parking available if you download the LAZ parking app and use Semicolon Cafe's promo code
Location: 10451 NE 2nd St., Bellevue, WA

A cute and trendy cafe in Bellevue with a unique menu and presentation of food.
1) Love the ambiance and aesthetics
2) A quick self-service was offered but the seating is very minimal
3) Recommend their S.O.S and Chicken Sandwiches ; Tiramisu Latte and Mocha - So good :)
Delicious sandwiches. The service was quick and the staff was friendly. The dine in area was clean and comfortable to work on your computer.
One of my favorite coffee shop in Bellevue. Avocado sandwich is 🔝
Food is okay. It’s something you can make at home. Cute place.
The sandwiches are sooo good! So fresh and fun

Very cute coffee shop in Bellevue over by the Safeway. I found it by chance and decided to give it a shot after I saw a TikTok video showing their menu.

They have a kiosk that you order off of and a small menu off to the side showing pictures and ingredients of what everything is. My husband and I got their sandwiches and a pink matcha lady. All of it was incredibly fresh and had amazing flavor. The shop was clean and had a cute little window table that felt private and quiet (if anyone is looking to sit and get some work done in a cute cafe).
takes too long to make a sandwich
Cute place in Bellevue! Sandwich was delicious!

Tastes really good!!! Very photogenic as well lololol
Would recommend!!
The decor is nice and cozy but the food is horrible. Won't recommend.

Friend and I came here for lunch and it was a wonderful experience. When you walk in, there is a kiosk to place your order and etc. They have many sandwiches and drinks to pick from!

I went with the Bulgogi Sandwich & Strawberry Ade, both very delicious. I recommend coming here if you want a good sandwich, I can't wait to come back.

They gave us free samples of desserts to apologize for the long wait. So nice!

Also their Bulgogi sandwich is amazing, definitely my personal favourite.
What a wonderful experience!

Very tiny and cute sandwich and coffee shop . Limited seating capacity . They can validate 2 hour parking code with a promo code . Self service coffee shop . Service is quite quick . Limited menu but very exciting sandwich options and fruit drink choices . Seating is little uncomfortable for as it is wooden chairs . Avacado Sandwich is too good . Very berry drink is also good . Prices are very reasonable.
Excellent attention to detail and delicious, well balanced flavored lattes.  The tiramisu latte is worth coming back for 😄
Coffee is good. Bulgogi sandwich and macarons were excellent. We'll definitely be coming back!
Very disappointed in my experience. Lady matcha latte was way too sweet and sugar. Sandwiches were quick… too quick. Terrible flavor and the chicken was fried days ago. Not worth the hype!

When the quality of the food craftsmanship is present, Semicolon Cafe can be a delightful place for sandwiches, drinks, and desserts. But more often than not, it's not there. Soggy bread, incorrect ingredients, and stale ingredients are what I've encountered my past few visits there. The rare times they get it right, the bulgogi sandwich can be excellent.
The cafe can be busy, so it's not always guaranteed to find seating. The acoustics of the interior make it noisier than most places.
This cafe would be fun to try as a new experience, however it's not one of my go-tos because of the quality inconsistencies.
AMAZING!!!!
Cute little cafe, the Mango bingsoo was very nice.
There are such delicious sandwiches

Avocado sandwich was great. It'd have been perfect to have a non sweet (non brioche) option but I understand that'd against the essence of the place. Banana and strawberry smoothie was also good and not too sweet.

To find parking is a nightmare! It took me 15 min to find one. Also, I have never experienced at a café such a bad costumer service. How can this place ask for a tip if there is no interaction at all with anyone up front? I don’t understand. They could at least greet the costumers I did leave tip anyhow. One of the sandwiches was good, the other one was mediocre, I could barely eat it so I bought another one thinking a third option would turn out better. It was NOT the case and I was so disappointed to have spent $50 dollars on 3 small sandwiches and 2 drinks. Never coming back here again. I do think the presentation of the food is great, but not worth it.
the workers gave attitude for no reason and were very rude for no reason. Never coming back

Pretty good food LOVED the mushroom sandwich, it has lots of cheese and egg toast is pretty well also the bingsoos are really nice 👍 lots of cheese!!
Cake and ice shaved cream nice toppings too, and nice coffee!!! 👍👍👍👌👌👌 …
The food was ok
It's alright, a bit slow and the food is just ok.

I won't go back because service is quite bad. I don't expect people to be chirpy but don't take out your negativity on me .

Also this place likes to nickel and dime...charges more money for less ice and no ice.

Very limited seating, and it gets cold.  Best to sit behind the "menu" wall.

Sandwiches can't be order at the "tablet", have to do it with the cashier. The food was better than the drink .

Don't go this place. I ordered a smoothie and a sandwich. The smoothie was ready in 5 minutes, but the servers never call my name for another 5 minutes. It was 9:20am of Saturday, there were not many people around there, and my order was number 6, but their serving is soooo slow. I was thinking that they will call me when the sandwich is ready, but it is not. They called my name just for smoothie after it was ready for 5 minutes. Later, I got the sandwich (20min later although there was not that many orders were placed), it was cold and not fresh at all. I ordered bulgogi sandwich, and it was a cold sandwich, seems like they prepared it a long time ago and made sandwich after I complained about why the sandwich is not coming. The best part was the reaction of the server (lady with long hair). She keep mentioning "sorry, do you want refund"? "We will apply your feedback", but the attitude was to just let me shut up and go. Another funny moment was that she went inside the kitchen and yelled to the workers (making sandwiches) that why she need to here complain from me, and everything was the sandwich maker's fault, and I can hear that all very well at the table. Avoid this place if you don't like a cold sandwich nor slow serving.

Overhyped cafe. ordered matcha latte - taste bitter and tiramisu latte - taste overly sweet with very little coffee.
Theres also 0 description for ingredients on each menu items so hard to figure out what to order if you have dietary restriction
Highly recommend their sandwiches. Other items are tasty too. On the pricy side, and can get a tad busy.
Never disappoints, but there’s always a wait. The parking is no longer free for customers. They allowed dogs inside❤️ Their sandwiches worth the wait however 🥹

We ordered food online and got there. But then they said the kitchen is closed and will give us a refund. What??? If they are closed, they should not have taken any orders online! We drove here to pick up our food and wasted our time. This is the most terrible experience in my life.

Ordered a spicy chicken sandwich to go. Overall it’s pretty good, love the spicy sauce, not spicy but flavorful, the egg is super soft and perfect. The only thing is I paid $12 for a sandwich but it doesn’t fulfill.

Update: We went to this spot again for breakfast and dine in this time. Staffs are friendly and the store is very cozy, clean and very instagramable! I really appreciate that they allow dogs inside. It’s an amazing dining experience here! Will recommend dining in to enjoy the food and the space if you can!

wow! Deliciousness. We were staying at the AC hotel Marriott which was only a 2 min walk away.  the staff was friendly and the atmosphere was bright and comfortable. The food was very fresh with a ton of flavor. We ordered the shroom sandwich, matcha bomb, green machine, the chocolate bingsoo, mango bingsoo, and a couple macaroons. Everything exceeded our expectations.

This place is bomb, yummy egg sandwiches, delicious drinks and the best banana pudding. I recommend also trying the tiramisu latte, I think it has mascarpone on some sort of delish topping.

Also they have one of those automatic ordering kiosk things at the front, so if you hate talking to other humans it's perfect for you :P
Having an option to order via screen is nice for when you don't want to talk to people. The drinks are a little sweeter than I'm used to, but good flavour and aesthetic
Tiramisu latte is amazing. Very friendly staff
really bad Latte.

Bulgogi sandwich was great, the place was packed and didn’t have enough seats when I went, but we just walked to a nearby friend’s apartment to eat. Bellevue downtown park is nearby as well. Parking in the garage is free for 2 hours with their code, and the bathrooms are clean and nice.

Great modern cafe in Bellevue! The decor  really gave this cafe a cozy atmosphere. As for the food I got the shrooms sandwich and my only complaint was the size. I wish it was bigger for how good of a sandwich this was. If I was in the area in Bellevue I would definitely go to this spot again
Good vibes, good drinks and good sandwiches.  Had lots of good memories there.
Just loved the place
nice atmosphere, nice sandwich. Wouldn’t regret coming, but not as amazing as I thought.

Really awesome 👏
Recommend
The sandwiches are sooooo good 🤤 I'm a big fan of the matcha latte, I ask for triple sweetness and it's perfect 🧚‍♀️

Ordered a tiramisu latte and a Bulgogi sandwich. Sooo good and filling. I've been here a few times and really enjoy their matcha, bingsoo and sandwiches! What pushed me to write a review this time is the customer service. The lady at the counter seemed curt, and when I realized I had ordered wrongly an iced coffee instead of hot, and the receipt shows this, she offered to remake it hot (albeit curtly), so not wanting to make it worse I said nonono it's ok. But when my sandwich came out she had already remade the drink hot anyway and offered it to me all matter of fact. Actions speak louder than words. Made my morning, even though it was my mistake to start! 🙏
Ordered a bulgogi sandwich and a cup of matcha latte.  The latte was lukewarm and the foam was just cold.   The meat did not taste like bulgogi.  Very disappointing.
The service was quite pleasant, the food was hearty and the coffee was delicious☕️Thank
Great food, loved the croissant
The sandwich is a must try. Soft and fluffy bread pressed between hot eggs & lush greens.
Delicious. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had, and priced only at $10!!

I was there together with a friend  on 10/15.

What can I say about this place? …
the sandwich is good, but the cappuccino is the worst thing I have tried in this city, it was very hot and cooled down in my car for more than an hour. Feee
Ask if Brian can be your waiter if you go there on a Sunday. He is a great person and deserves your tips.

Delicious Korean egg sandos!! The bread is buttery and soft. I substituted the bulgogi sauce for truffle sauce. It had a subtle truffle flavor and tasted somewhat like caesar salad dressing. The egg could be more custard-like honestly. The …

If I can give 0 star I would.

I've been there several times but the last visit was the worst due to the bad …
Great sandwiches, although more seating would be optimal

Place was super cute, loved all the plants. Sandwiches were good and different to what we are used too eating which I love! We ordered the lox and bulgogi sandwich also a tiramisu latte and strawberry banana smoothie, everything was good. …
Great latte and sandwich and I love the feeling of the cafe!

Very cute cafe with all the right vibes 🫶🏼
Quick service and my Avocado Sandwich was tasty. If you’re a serious coffee lover, this is not the place for you. The other drinks on the menu looked great. …

Cashier girl didn’t stop scanning and rolling her eyes at us while we were ordering. Her face showed obviously madness at us and it was so frustrating. We came to experience a chill-lax Sunday but it was ruined by her unprofessional service! 0 out of 10 stars!!

The worst customer service ever. The young lady at the cashier was so rude and disrespectful to her customers. She was pretending to be nice right after her manager/ boss came out but before that it was terrible!!!
Good coffe and sandwich to go, quick and easy. Thank you

Amazing drinks ☕️🧋 and tasty breakfast 🥪.
Loved the tiramisu latte and mango banana smoothie. The break fast sandwich was very tasty, very happy, and had nice atmosphere and music played …
It was delicious

this my fav place to get matcha ! the matcha bomb drink is soooo good !!! they also have creative drinks as the tiramisu latte and this strawberry matcha drink, both were delicious. they have a nice variety of drinks including smoothies and …

0 stars. do not recommend.
Disgusting service and rude employee!
Terrible experience here. I tried to ask this employee in the picture for a recommendation, but she rolled her eyes at me and singed. Just do your job pls
Great coffee,  loved the sandwich

Cute coffee shop. The sandwich and the swoosh are super nice. If you want the cute little box it only provides for dine-in customer. I think the price isbreasonable because both of them are delicious and I will visit again if I have a chance.
Had the bulgogi sandwich, delicious. Although the bulgogi had a tendency to fall out 🙁 so it is messy eating. …
Cute atmosphere and yummy sandwiches! Cons were the fruit flies.

Cute little cafe near Downtown Bellevue Park! I arrived around 10am on a Monday morning, and there was hardly any wait, although many of my friends say that it gets quite crowded during lunch time. I ordered a bulgogi sandwich and a …
A coffee shop that does sandwiches perfectly.

Really enjoyed the sandwiches here. Well balanced saucing in side. Brioche was wonderfully buttered and toaster. Not too much bread vs inside. Get your food fast also. Two sandwiches. 3 drinks for about 45.
They have some next level breakfast sandwiches. I got the lox version and the strawberry matcha drink. Definitely try a sandwich with your drink!
Great place for lunch! Sandwiches are very yummy with soft cooked eggs inside!
I had matcha latte and chicken sandwich and both of them are tasty. The restaurant is also good for photo taking.
Delicious sandwich, try Bulgogi and Chicken, both are good, love the sauces
Nice, bright spot. Fairly clean with nice decor of your typical vinery. Prices are reasonable. Basically bingsoo instead of bubble tea (bingsoo in a cup).

Had the worst experience with this place recently. My friend and I came in for coffee and sandwich. It was around 4:10 pm and they close at 5pm. 20 minutes later, around 4:30pm they start to clean the place while customers are still there. …

Nice little cafe with a modern aesthetic located near Bellevue downtown park. Can get very busy so plan to wait or just order to-go. There is complimentary parking in the garage next to it; the code and app you need are inside the cafe. The …
I really wanted to like this place from what it looked like, but it was ultimately pretty disappointing. I think most cafes that are aesthetic have a 50/50 chance of not actually being good. …

Beautiful and clean cafe. I tried the flat white and the Shroom sandwich. The sandwich was delicious and the truffle sauce was yummy.
The coffee, however, was okay, not like a specially coffee.
